docs.snippet: Millions of dollars are spent on monitoring N.F.L. players, but several episodes involving Aaron Hernandez were missed or ignored in the year before he was charged with murder....
docs.lead_paragraph: Millions of dollars are spent on monitoring N.F.L. players, but several episodes involving Aaron Hernandez were missed or ignored in the year before he was charged with murder.
docs.abstract: NFL and its teams spend millions on security, protecting and monitoring buildings and players to safeguard the integrity of its multimillion-dollar brand; fact that several episodes involving former New England Patriots tight end Aaron Hernandez were missed or ignored in the year before he was charged with murder make his case all the more curious.

headline.main: Hernandez’s Troubles Rose Under N.F.L.’s Vigilant Eye
headline.print_headline: Hernandez’s Troubles Rose Under N.F.L.’s Vigilant Eye

docs.snippet: With salaries and concerns about injuries soaring, N.F.L. teams are increasingly limiting contact during training camps, which were once grueling ordeals under a merciless sun....
docs.lead_paragraph: With salaries and concerns about injuries soaring, N.F.L. teams are increasingly limiting contact during training camps, which were once grueling ordeals under a merciless sun.
docs.abstract: NFL teams are increasingly limiting physical contact during training camps, as salaries and concerns about injuries continue to soar; coaches and owners are weighing risk and cost of preseason injuries, while players are responding to research outlining cumulative, debilitating effects of recurrent head trauma; precautionary changes have left football's training landscape unrecognizable from decade earlier.

headline.main: New Rule at N.F.L.’s Camps: No Tackling. It’s Just Practice.
headline.print_headline: New Rule at N.F.L.’s Camps: No Tackling. It’s Just Practice.

byline.contributor: Ben Shpigel and Scott Cacciola contributed reporting.Ben Shpigel and Scott Cacciola contributed reporting.

docs.snippet: Riley Cooper was fined by his team after a video surfaced in which he used a racial slur at a Kenny Chesney concert, and the N.F.L. issued a statement reprimanding him....
docs.lead_paragraph: Riley Cooper was fined by his team after a video surfaced in which he used a racial slur at a Kenny Chesney concert, and the N.F.L. issued a statement reprimanding him.
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver Riley Cooper apologizes after video surfaces in which he used a racial slur at a country music concert; other football news noted.

headline.main: Eagles Receiver Cooper Apologizes for Using Racial Slur at Concert

docs.snippet: The security that Fabrice Tourre helped to create while he worked at Goldman Sachs was a pure gamble. One side bet that the mortgage market would collapse; the other bet it would not. What’s the difference between that and betting on a football ...
docs.abstract: The security that Fabrice Tourre helped to create while he worked at Goldman Sachs was a pure gamble. One side bet that the mortgage market would collapse; the other bet it would not. What’s the difference between that and betting on a football game?
